author: busyguy1
title: The Cardano Classroom
description: 早期教育严重缺乏关于财务独立的课程，更缺乏关于区块链的课程，增加了财富差距。

f6_assessments.q0: 根据我的理解，该提案旨在通过创建一个教育平台，传播有关区块链技术和Cardano的知识，但重点是年轻人。目前还没有很多项目专注于从早期培养意识和知识，所以这个提案有一个非常独特的视角和目的，绝对能解决这个挑战。教育我们成长中的社区将永远是一个优先事项，通过我作为教师和社区参与者的经验，在 "种子层面 "上解决这个问题，并有目的性地创造一个子社区，是非常有价值的。它可能不仅包括年轻的人到Cardano，而且还向他们的父母、朋友和联系人传播信息和知识。即使他们有区块链的经验或没有。该提案的细节呈现得很清楚，与问题陈述有很强的联系。有人提出（我也同意），这是一个缓慢燃烧的项目和长期投资，这将解释为什么有些部分被解释得更广泛，更接近详细的概念而不是数字和数据。总而言之，我非常同意这个提案有效地解决了这个挑战。
f6_assessments.q1:
该提案清楚地说明了在一定的时间范围内要实现的目标，以及为实现这一目标所需要的东西。真正重要的是，无论是否获得FUND7的资助，提案人都希望继续发展该项目，这说明了长期的决心和承诺。网站已经上线（但还没有活跃的平台，路线图中提供了时间框架）。由于它意味着要在很短的时间内做很多事情，预算分配相当可观（占挑战赛总预算的1/4），这对最初的一轮融资来说可能太大。也许该项目将受益于专注于平台的核心方面（教育、课程、视频等），而将诸如 "沉浸式技术 "之类的东西留到以后的基金中去？我理解从一开始就推出一个完全实现的项目的价值，但从我作为教师的经验来看，为了增加获得资金的机会，在最初阶段把重点放在核心教育内容和教师的工作上可能会更有好处。
我希望看到更多关于这个项目的创造者的可证实的信息和背景，也许是一个LinkedIn-profile，以进一步加强核心创造者的教学专业知识？有一个播客采访的链接，它提供了一些关于提案人背景和知识的信息。此外，还有人提到了个人的LinkedIn，但这并不包括在内。
该团队似乎缺少很多技术专长，但这在预算分配中被考虑到了。这可能解释了为什么一些技术或具体方面没有包括在详细的计划中，而这些内容包括在提案中是有益的。
 我同意这个提案极有可能被成功实施。
f6_assessments.q2:
提案中有一个明确的路线图，包括时间框架。它是雄心勃勃的，最初横跨6个月，但提案人明确表示，在接下来的时间里还有更多的里程碑和目标。我相信，如果提案中包括更多的关键绩效指标或成功指标，对提案会有好处。目前提供的信息是依靠入职的社区和教育互动，但没有数字来衡量项目的成功和发展。有一个提到30-60名Beta测试学生的目标，这为我们提供了一些成功的衡量标准。
预算明细非常清楚，但如果能看到一些关于估计工作时间的进一步细节就更好了。例如，8000美元被分配给经过审查的教育工作者，但如果包括估计的工作时间、教育工作者的数量等，将进一步加强该提案。提案人似乎对开发项目的风险和挑战有很好的理解，主要是需要在核心团队之外雇用不同的教育工作者和技术开发人员的危险，以及因此而失去教育材料的一致性的风险。时间框架也被提到是一个可能的挑战，这一点我在前面提到过。
总的来说，我同意这个提案为我提供了足够的信息来评估实现其既定目标的进展。

f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have  not provided evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  building this classroom. In fact much of the expense is for external costs such as external gurus,platform creation and maintenance, hardware, video production equipment, Hiring educationists to build curriculum, hiring cardano developers to record videos, buying of VR software and hardware, Occulus quest devices, etc. Over 10% is going for branded merchandise and a further amount for social swag. They have also included a stakepool which is definitely not in the scope of this challenge. 
  
 The links are not sufficient. The main website cardanoclassroom.com is just an image on the domain home page. No links or anything has been given.  
 
I have visited these links
   
The proposers cannot be said to be experienced and competent to do the project since most of the work is done by external resources and the cost is exorbitantly high 
 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is not stated.

The team structure isnt  listed and experienced.

Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
 The budget has been given in detail. It appears quite high and as stated above most of the costs are for external resources. 

I would suggest to scale down the project and build a few classes with lesser resources in a manner which you are able to do without so much dependence on large hardware and software purchases.

The budget is not reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required 

There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 
 
Theres no realistic timetable  to complete the work. There is a time table but i dont believe its realistic to complete all the stated work in 6 months.  
 
The proposal doesnt give  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .
 
Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   
  
The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 
 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal  
 
Given experience and plan presented it is  highly unlikely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is not reasonable hence I have given it a 1 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones  
 

 There are  no Metrics given by propose 
   
The problem has been understood and solution has been given broadly. My professional opinion is that it does not fit into the challenge goals.
  
 
    The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties. 
Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
 

Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

f6_assessments.q0: Although this is a beautiful idea, it is in the wrong Challenge for it seeks to create a platform that provides video education for the youth rather than initiating an event. This proposal in its current state does not fit in any particular Challenge. Though 'DApps and Integration' or 'Scale-UP Cardano's Community Hub' does a bit fit, especially if the proposer were to also create an accompanying DApps. The proposer can also attempt to issue their own Challenge for Fund 9 with the topic; Providing Educational Tools that are constructed based on proficiency levels. If it were to be forced assessed based on the Challenge settings, this proposal would just barely solve the problem of onboarding and integrating new people. Since it involves education, it is highly recommended the proposer to reach out to the Catalyst School and explore avenues of collaboration.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no detailed experience provided. Of that is provided the experience is too vague and cannot be accounted for. No links are available also. This trend continues on to the team members. There is a notion that a certain individual with a particular skillset is needed, but who that individual is, is not stated. The budget asked does to an extent indicates the proposer has not been properly involved in the Project Catalyst process. Simply put, the proposer asks funding to create a platform from roughly zero. The funds will be used to create the platform; digitally and legally, to create the syllabus, to purchase hardware to create the syllabus, to purchase a lot in the VR space, to purchase the VR tool to access the VR space etc. This thought process is incorrect, for the Project Catalyst is not a fund to all-out purchase physical items for the proposers benefit. It is an empowerment tool, Project Catalyst to an extent is like a VC. And like a VC, when one does ask for funding they do not all-out ask to purchase various items without some form of validation for these purchases. Reckon this is purely due to having being still inexperienced in the Project Catalyst community. Again, highly reckon to reach out to Catalyst School and also to join the Project Catalyst Discord channel if they have not yet.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap provided has an adjoining action plan but no specific milestones. There are also no measurable KPI's provided therefore auditing this proposal will be challenging, most specifically in term of deliverables effectiveness. Problem statement and solution is quite solid. If deliverables were to mention dApps and this proposal were to be in the 'DApps and Integration' Challenge, reckon the ratings would be more preferable. Please do submit again a proposal for Fund 8. Prior to that, please kindly go through the materials of Catalyst School, or even better participate in their workshops.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is certainly interesting, I wonder what age the proposal is intended for. Is it intended for high school students in specific education, so that there is already a basic interest or is it intended for students in general, also non-economic fields? The danger is that students drop out if the content does not interest them or seems too difficult. I also wonder if the information is one-sided, just from Cardano's point of view. This cannot be the intention to include unilateral information in the curriculum of the students.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal involves opening an online platform about Cardano. The problem is very suitable for Challenge and quite interesting. The solution is clearly defined; building such an online class has an expected impact both in the short and long term to the Cardano Blockchain. My advice is: you should define the target group (ex: age,..) of this course.

f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is about the education platform. This team's (consist of proposer and his daughter) profile is described briefly enough for understanding with skill, experiences are suitable for implementation but it is hard to verify this through the link provided (http://cardanoclassroom.com/). Youtube links show that the proposer has done some similar activities with acceptable quality (my subjective evaluation).  The requested budget (>20% of the challenge)  is provided with structures, however, for a better view and understanding, the proposer should consider grouping cost items and providing explanations of the calculation base for each item. The defined challenge (balancing the organization of content with multiple creators while keeping the consistency of variety in course preparation to accommodate the needs of different student needs) is logical but without mitigation/risk management; my advice is a well-designed template and framework could be a solution to this kind of risk, the proposer should consider this.

Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility and I would give a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2:
The team's profile is described with limited information and it is hard to clarify through the link provided (http://cardanoclassroom.com/).  Information related to Roadmap, Timeline is presented enough to understand, however, the requested budget (which is >20% of the challenge's fund) contains many unclear points, making it difficult for the community to monitor. (ex: What is the basis for calculating cost items?). My advice is: for better auditability, as mentioned, the proposer should consider grouping cost items and providing explanations of the calculation base for each item. Besides, KPIs should be provided.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability and give this proposal with a score of 3

Both of the platform and educational contents are described understandable clearly what is being done as well as how to do (platform: in the description and in the budget broken down; the teaching contents: in the description and in sample curriculum which is suituable for pre-teen learners).
